html:
Master of Business Academic Orientation

This module provides learners with the knowledge and skills to help them transition into postgraduate / level 7 education. In preparing learners to succeed in postgraduate studies, they will learn how to effectively utilise a range of academic sources including AI in their studies, as well identifying and reflecting on the skills and knowledge they will need to develop in order succeed in the workplace and gain employment upon graduation.

The aim of this module is to help guide students into understanding the expectations of postgraduate studies and to develop and enhance existing academic and study skills.

There will also be a focus on preparing study for employment – by covering key employability skills such as CV / Resumes/ personal skills audits

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Critically understand the skills and knowledge required to be an effective learner at postgraduate level studies (knowledge and Understanding).

+  Demonstrate a critical awareness of issues and challenges relating to undertaking a year-long business project (knowledge and Understanding).

+  Prepare for employment by identifying relevant personal skills needed upon graduation through the use of reflective practice (Knowledge and Understanding, application, reflection).

+  Identify and critically evaluate the potential impact of current advances and industry trends in a chosen field of study (Understanding, analysis, learning and application).
